intro: Pentacalia silvascandens, commonly known as the silver scandens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its aesthetic appeal.
